theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of DNA Replication and Genome Stability in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic control of DNA replication origin inactivation and its impact on genomic stability and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of DNA Repair and Chromatin Relaxation in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on histone acetylation (H4K16ac) controlling chromatin relaxation to facilitate DNA repair, linking epigenetic changes to repair efficiency and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of DNA Replication and Genome Stability in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of replication-associated epigenetic errors (CpG methylation) as a mitotic clock reflecting cellular division history and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Global Epigenetic Dysregulation and Chromatin Remodeling in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes broad epigenetic drift, chromatin remodeling, 3D genome architecture changes, and transposon activation as central aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Global Epigenetic Dysregulation and Chromatin Remodeling in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on 3D genome reorganization, nuclear lamina loss, and epigenomic entropy as mechanisms of aging-related chromatin changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Global Epigenetic Dysregulation and Chromatin Remodeling in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes age-associated chromatin remodeling and epigenetic instability as drivers of aging and targets of longevity interventions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Global Epigenetic Dysregulation and Chromatin Remodeling in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details age-dependent heterochromatin remodeling via H3K9me3 gain and chromatin deterioration contributing to aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Global Epigenetic Dysregulation and Chromatin Remodeling in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes self-reinforcing epigenetic feedback loops that maintain altered chromatin states driving aging and cancer, linking genetic and metabolic factors.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Global Epigenetic Dysregulation and Chromatin Remodeling in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes irreversible loss of epigenetic signals and lack of repair mechanisms as universal causes of aging across life forms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Histone Modification and HDAC Regulation in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on histone acetylation/deacetylation balance, HDACs including sirtuins, and their role in lifespan regulation and anti-aging therapeutics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Histone Modification and HDAC Regulation in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details histone modification dynamics in mesenchymal stem cell aging, emphasizing reversible epigenetic marks and therapeutic potential.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Histone Modification and HDAC Regulation in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes NuA4 acetyltransferase-mediated lysine acetylation of nonhistone proteins regulating metabolism and lifespan in yeast.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of Stem Cell Aging and Exhaustion
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic alterations controlling stem cell fate, function, and exhaustion contributing to tissue aging and systemic decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of Stem Cell Aging and Exhaustion
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of epigenetic errors in stem cells and rejuvenation via nuclear reprogramming resetting epigenetic age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of Stem Cell Aging and Exhaustion
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes epigenetic silencing of proregenerative genes limiting regenerative capacity with aging, involving heterochromatin restructuring.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of Stem Cell Aging and Exhaustion
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links epigenetic control of EMT-MET programs to cellular plasticity, senescence, and stemness, influencing aging and regeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Regulation of Stem Cell Aging and Exhaustion
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic mechanisms driving aging and neurodegeneration, integrating gene expression regulation and stem cell dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Methylation-Driven Epigenetic Regulation of Aging and Lifespan
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA methylation changes as conserved regulators of lifespan, with pharmacological modulation affecting aging-related pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Methylation-Driven Epigenetic Regulation of Aging and Lifespan
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-associated DNA methylation changes at retroelements causing their reactivation, contributing to inflammaging and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Methylation-Driven Epigenetic Regulation of Aging and Lifespan
theory_assignments.reasoning: General epigenetic theory emphasizing DNA methylation and histone modifications as aging drivers and epigenetic clocks as biomarkers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Methylation-Driven Epigenetic Regulation of Aging and Lifespan
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uses DNA methylation clocks to show accelerated epigenetic aging in painful diabetic neuropathy, linking methylation to disease and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Methylation-Driven Epigenetic Regulation of Aging and Lifespan
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes common epigenetic mechanisms including global hypomethylation and gene-specific hypermethylation in aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Programmed Epigenetic Information Loss in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes a programmed gene regulatory mechanism causing active DNA methylation decay and epigenomic integrity loss driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Programmed Epigenetic Information Loss in Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes transgenerational inheritance of longevity via nutritional-induced heritable epigenetic changes affecting lifespan regulation.
